preChecks.remediationMsg: Repository validation failed. Check if repository configuration is correct and manually validate from UI in Repository page or in CLI using: show repository <reponame>
preChecks.name: REPOSITORY_CHECK
preChecks.successMsg: Repository for bundle is validated successfully

preChecks.remediationMsg: For upgrade, there is minimum free memory requirement of 25% on PAN and 1GB on all other nodes. Make sure minimum required memory is there in ISE nodes. CLI to check memory: show memory
preChecks.name: MEMORY_CHECK
preChecks.successMsg: Memory check passed on all ISE nodes

preChecks.remediationMsg: Detected filesystem errors, use 'application configure ise' from CLI and select 'Check and Repair Filesystem' to fix them. If the issue still persists, please re-image the node with required upgrade version and restore the backup.
preChecks.name: DISK_CORRUPTION_CHECK

preChecks.remediationMsg: Make sure deployment has supported platforms by referring Cisco Identity Services Engine Installation Guide. Any unsupported platform should be removed from deployment. Use CLI to check platform information on individual node: show udi
preChecks.message: aws-psn.securitydemo.net-Error: At least 8 CPU cores required for upgrade.  $ aws-psn2.securitydemo.net-Error: At least 8 CPU cores required for upgrade.  $ azure-psn.securitydemo.net-Error: At least 8 CPU cores required for upgrade.  $ azure-psn2.securitydemo.net-Error: At least 8 CPU cores required for upgrade.  $ oci-psn.securitydemo.net-Error: At least 8 CPU cores required for upgrade.  $ oci-psn2.securitydemo.net-Error: At least 8 CPU cores required for upgrade.  $ vmware-admin.securitydemo.net-Error: At least 8 CPU cores required for upgrade.  $

preChecks.name: PLATFORM_CHECK
preChecks.successMsg: All nodes have supported platform for ISE installation and upgrade.

preChecks.remediationMsg: Make sure ISE FQDN can be resolved against configured DNS server for both forward and reverse lookup. CLI: nslookup [FQDN|IP address]. Make sure to configure proper DNS server where ISE FQDN will resolve on all ISE nodes
preChecks.message: vmware-admin.securitydemo.net-DNS resolution succeeded against 10.1.100.10 \$ DNS resolution failed against 8.8.8.8 \$ Reverse DNS resolution succeeded for 10.1.100.40 $ vmware-sadmin.securitydemo.net-DNS resolution succeeded against 10.1.100.10 \$ DNS resolution failed against 8.8.8.8 \$ Reverse DNS resolution succeeded for 10.1.100.41 $

nodes.msg: DNS resolution succeeded against 10.1.100.10 \$ Reverse DNS resolution succeeded for 192.168.104.110

nodes.msg: DNS resolution succeeded against 10.1.100.10 \$ Reverse DNS resolution succeeded for 192.168.104.111
nodes.name: aws-psn2.securitydemo.net

nodes.msg: DNS resolution succeeded against 10.1.100.10 \$ Reverse DNS resolution succeeded for 192.168.100.110
nodes.name: azure-psn.securitydemo.net

nodes.msg: DNS resolution succeeded against 10.1.100.10 \$ Reverse DNS resolution succeeded for 192.168.100.111

preChecks.name: DNS_CHECK
preChecks.successMsg: DNS Resolution was successful for all nodes.

preChecks.remediationMsg: Check if admin certificate for ISE node is valid in Certificate UI. Remaining all certificate can be invalid but its recommended to have valid certificate for all services. Replace all expired certificates with valid one
preChecks.name: SYSTEM_CERT_CHECK
preChecks.successMsg: All system certs are valid and not expired.

preChecks.remediationMsg: For upgrade to work smoothly, 2 times the upgrade bundle size needs to be free in /opt partition. Use 'show disk' CLI command to check free space in /opt
preChecks.name: DISK_SPACE_CHECK
preChecks.successMsg: Sufficient disk space is available on all nodes.

preChecks.remediationMsg: Make sure valid NTP is configured and time source is NTP on all ISE nodes. CLI: show ntp
preChecks.displayname: NTP Reachability and Time Source Check
preChecks.name: NTP_CHECK

preChecks.remediationMsg: Check for Load average for last 1 min, 5 min and 15 min; System should not be highly loaded. Alarms are generated when system is highly loaded for longer period
preChecks.name: LOAD_AVERAGE_CHECK

preChecks.remediationMsg: All the services should be either running or in disabled state. Check 'show application status ise' in ISE admin CLI.
preChecks.name: SERVICES_CHECK
preChecks.successMsg: All services on nodes are running.

preChecks.remediationMsg: Some or All nodes might not be in sync or might be unreachable. Make sure nodes are reachable and are in sync from Deployment UI. Retry this check once all ISE nodes in deployment shows in Sync in Deployment UI
preChecks.name: DEPLOYMENT_CHECK

preChecks.remediationMsg: Bundle download failed. Check if bundle is accessible from repository. Check MD5 or SHA256 sum of bundle matches with source. Check connectivity between individual ISE node and repository
preChecks.name: BUNDLE_DOWNLOAD_CHECK
preChecks.successMsg: Bundle download on all ISE nodes completed successfully

preChecks.remediationMsg: PAN failover is enabled. During Staging process, it will be disabled to proceed for upgrade
preChecks.name: PAN_FAILOVER_CHECK
preChecks.successMsg: PAN failover validation passed. PAN failover is not enabled

preChecks.remediationMsg: Cisco recommends to take backup of ISE configuration and operational data before upgrade. Make sure to have backup of working configuration and operational data
preChecks.message: vmware-admin.securitydemo.net- Any ongoing backups will be stopped at the time of upgrade $ Cisco recommends you to take scheduled backup on frequent basis $  $

nodes.msg: Any ongoing backups will be stopped at the time of upgrade $ Cisco recommends you to take scheduled backup on frequent basis $
nodes.name: vmware-admin.securitydemo.net

preChecks.name: SCHEDULE_BACKUP_CHECK
preChecks.successMsg: Scheduled Backup is configured in ISE

preChecks.remediationMsg: Cisco recommends to take backup of ISE configuration and operational data before upgrade. Make sure to have a recent backup of working configuration and operational data
preChecks.message: vmware-admin.securitydemo.net-Config Backup Check completed. Your backup is more than one month old, older than the best practice recommendation for the upgrade process. Please collect a recent backup prior to beginning the upgrade process. $

nodes.msg: Config Backup Check completed. Your backup is more than one month old, older than the best practice recommendation for the upgrade process. Please collect a recent backup prior to beginning the upgrade process.
nodes.name: vmware-admin.securitydemo.net

preChecks.name: CONFIG_BACKUP_CHECK
preChecks.successMsg: Config Backup is taken for ISE in recent time

preChecks.remediationMsg: Configuration data upgrade failed. Check log using CLI on SPAN or Standalone node: show logging application configdb-upgrade-&lttimestamp&gt.log . Contact TAC incase of issue with data in ISE
preChecks.name: DB_UPGRADE_CHECK

preChecks.remediationMsg: Make sure that admin certificate is present under Trusted store. if the admin certificate is not present in trusted store export the certificate and import it in trusted certificates store

nodes.msg: Admin Certificate is not Self Signed Skipping check
nodes.name: vmware-admin.securitydemo.net

preChecks.displayname: Admin Certificate Check in Trusted store
preChecks.name: ADMIN_CERT_CHECK
preChecks.successMsg: Admin Certificate Check passed on all ISE nodes

preChecks.remediationMsg: Its recommended to have proper trust certificate chain for all system certificate. Any expired trusted certificate should be disabled or removed from ISE, if not in use. If being used, replace with valid certificate
preChecks.name: TRUST_CERT_CHECK
preChecks.successMsg: All trust certificate are valid and not expired.

preChecks.remediationMsg: Make sure ISE nodes are able to reach to configured MDM server (if any)
preChecks.name: MDM_CHECK
